io.spine.server.aggregate

Class AggregateStorage<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
      • io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStorage<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of IDs of aggregates managed by this storage
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>, StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @SPI
public abstract class AggregateStorage<I>
extends AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
implements StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
    An event-sourced storage of aggregate part events and snapshots.

      • checkNotClosed

        protected void checkNotClosed()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Ensures the storage is not closed.

        If the storage is closed, throws IllegalStateException.

        Opens the method for the package.

        Overrides:
        checkNotClosed in class AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage is closed

      • index

        public java.util.Iterator<I> index()
        Returns an iterator over identifiers of records in the storage.

        Attempts to read aggregate IDs from the MirrorRepository, as they are already stored there in a convenient form.

        If an aggregate MirrorRepository is not configured to use for reads with this repository, falls back to the default method of getting distinct aggregate IDs from the event records.

        Specified by:
        index in interface Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>

      • read

        public java.util.Optional<io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory> read(AggregateReadRequest<I> request)
        Forms and returns an AggregateHistory based on the aggregate history.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Parameters:
        request - the aggregate read request based on which to form a record
        Returns:
        the record instance or Optional.empty() if the aggregate history is empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • write

        public void write(I id,
                  io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory events)
        Writes events into the storage.

        NOTE: does not rewrite any events. Several events can be associated with one aggregate ID.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Storage<I,io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateHistory,AggregateReadRequest<I>>
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the record
        events - non empty aggregate state record to store

      • writeRecord

        protected abstract void writeRecord(I id,
                                    io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateEventRecord record)
        Writes the passed record into the storage.
        Parameters:
        id - the aggregate ID
        record - the record to write

      • historyBackward

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateEventRecord> historyBackward(AggregateReadRequest<I> request)
        Creates iterator of aggregate event history with the reverse traversal.

        Records are sorted by timestamp descending (from newer to older). The iterator is empty if there's no history for the aggregate with passed ID.

        Parameters:
        request - the read request
        Returns:
        new iterator instance

      • truncate

        protected abstract void truncate(int snapshotIndex)
        Drops all records which occur before the Nth snapshot for each entity.

      • truncate

        protected abstract void truncate(int snapshotIndex,
                                 com.google.protobuf.Timestamp date)
        Drops all records older than date but not newer than the Nth snapshot for each entity.

      • distinctAggregateIds

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<I> distinctAggregateIds()
        Obtains distinct aggregate IDs from the stored event records.
